verb.description: Gradually but firmly establish (an idea or attitude, especially a desirable one) in a person's mind.
examples: how do we instill a sense of rightness in today's youth?

verb.description: Put (a substance) into something in the form of liquid drops.
examples: she was told how to instill eye drops

origin: Late Middle English (in instill (sense 2)): from Latin instillare, from in- into + stillare to drop (from stilla a drop).
